description: This course examines historically significant conceptions of reality and knowledge focusing on philosophy's contributions to Western culture. Major philosophers from ancient, medieval, and modern Western philosophy are introduced and assessed for their contributions to our understanding of the universe, human nature, and values. Some sections offer a survey of Western philosophy; others stress intensive study of central figures and works. Consult departmental prospectus for details. Offered annually. Prerequisite: first-year student or sophomore standing.
name: Making of Modern Mind
notes: Open only to first-year and sophomore students.
Open only to first and second-year students

title: The Making of the Modern Mind
